{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3330247,"name":"Cole Wilson","username":"colew","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/f19dbf/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-11T18:43:01.163Z","cooked":"

Hello, our team has been having some problems with PhotonVision. We are using an Orange Pi 5 powered with a 5V3A buck convertor, and an Arducam OV9281 camera for AprilTags. We have also tried using some old Microsoft webcams for note detection with success. The code and settings are working quite well, but after a seemingly random amount of time, the camera stops sending data. The PhotonVision still shows the camera name, but the stream is just a yellow box with a loading screen. The only way we can fix this is by power cycling the Orange Pi completely, or by unplugging the camera, waiting a while, and plugging it back in. It seems like a wiring connection issue, and we are planning on hot-gluing the USB extender to the Pi and soldering the connections from the camera cable to the extender. I was curious if any other teams are having issues with this, or whether there is a different issue at play here. As far as I’m aware we aren’t having any brownout issues, and PhotonVision itself stays connected, just not the camera to PhotonVision.

Thanks!

Is that what you observe UI partially crashes every few minutes · Issue #1182 · PhotonVision/photonvision (github.com) ?

Did you get the chance to look at all the post in that thread PhotonVision OjectDetection camera sometimes missing on boot - Technical / PhotonVision - Chief Delphi ?

Welcome to the club.

@gartaud thank you for sending these: I do believe this is a similar issue. However, this appears to be happening even with AprilTags not just object detection. However, it’s possible that because we have an object detection camera plugged in it may be causing the same issues? What have teams been doing to get around this?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2024-03-11T21:11:32.555Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":230,"readers_count":229,"score":56.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":458277,"topic_slug":"photonvision-losing-connection-orange-pi","display_username":"Cole Wilson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62619,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/photonvision-losing-connection-orange-pi/458277/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3330486,"name":"Chris Gerth","username":"gerthworm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gerthworm/{size}/268658_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-11T21:25:35.177Z","cooked":"
colew:

However, it’s possible that because we have an object detection camera plugged in it may be causing the same issues?

The presence of an object detection pipeline seems to be a common symptom.

The root cause per dmseg logs seems to be out of memory - multiple things being looked at there.

One thing to note - if the root cause is indeed out of memory, the timing teams see would be dependent on how much memory was available, which in turn depends on the hardware that’s running, and other pipelines and processes.

@gerthworm Hmm, okay thank you for your response! So do think if I start with a fresh configuration and setup and only do AprilTags from now on it may fix it? Note detection would be nice but we really need the AprilTag stuff to work so I’m willing to sacrifice it to get it to work.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2024-03-11T21:35:22.622Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":191,"readers_count":190,"score":48.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":458277,"topic_slug":"photonvision-losing-connection-orange-pi","display_username":"Cole Wilson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":24617,"username":"gerthworm","name":"Chris Gerth","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gerthworm/{size}/268658_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62619,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/photonvision-losing-connection-orange-pi/458277/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3330527,"name":"Dan Langdon","username":"woodworker2001","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/w/bbe5ce/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-11T21:56:19.353Z","cooked":"

Second camera and second pi? That way you have apriltags on one and note detection on the other? If you lose note detection you can live with it?

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2024-03-11T21:56:19.353Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":177,"readers_count":176,"score":35.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":458277,"topic_slug":"photonvision-losing-connection-orange-pi","display_username":"Dan Langdon","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":62619,"username":"colew","name":"Cole Wilson","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/f19dbf/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51496,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/photonvision-losing-connection-orange-pi/458277/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3330546,"name":"Vaughn Khouri","username":"CyberClone","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cyberclone/{size}/229178_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-11T22:16:07.237Z","cooked":"

How are you powering it? We wasted like a day trying to debug an Orange pi that we plugged into Rio USB. It turns out it’ll put out enough current to get the dashboard up, but as soon as you try to interact the current spikes and it ghost restarts.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2024-03-11T22:16:07.237Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":176,"readers_count":175,"score":50.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":458277,"topic_slug":"photonvision-losing-connection-orange-pi","display_username":"Vaughn Khouri","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52319,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/photonvision-losing-connection-orange-pi/458277/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3330551,"name":"","username":"MoonlitJolty","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/moonlitjolty/{size}/12129_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-11T22:21:16.421Z","cooked":"

In line with the question of how is it being powered, we had an issue where even when powered off a battery pack it still lost power. The problem ended up being that the pi side of the cord wasn’t reliably staying connected due to the case it was in. We cut the wire and plugged power in directly through the GPIO pins and haven’t had a power issue since.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2024-03-11T22:21:33.812Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":169,"readers_count":168,"score":58.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":458277,"topic_slug":"photonvision-losing-connection-orange-pi","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31927,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"447 Software Mentor | Super Scouter Dev"},"post_url":"/t/photonvision-losing-connection-orange-pi/458277/8","custom_user_title":"447 Software Mentor | Super Scouter Dev","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3330553,"name":"Cole Wilson","username":"colew","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/f19dbf/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-11T22:23:28.702Z","cooked":"

We are powering it with a lead from a 5A fuse on Rev PDH, connected to a 5V3A buck covertor that has USB output. We then power it with a standard usbC cable. I don’t believe power is an issue (could be wrong) because we maintain strong coonection with PV just not camera

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2024-03-11T22:23:28.702Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":167,"readers_count":166,"score":48.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":458277,"topic_slug":"photonvision-losing-connection-orange-pi","display_username":"Cole Wilson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":31927,"username":"MoonlitJolty","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/moonlitjolty/{size}/12129_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62619,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/photonvision-losing-connection-orange-pi/458277/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3330689,"name":"gartaud","username":"gartaud","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/a4c791/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-12T01:11:38.119Z","cooked":"

Read that post though Powering an Orange Pi 5 - Technical / Electrical - Chief Delphi

We have had similar issues, often when we’ve been up for a long time. We have no idea of the cause; we are scrapping the OrangePi for right now.

When it freezes, does PhotonVision stop incremented the heartbeat?

How is your Orange Pi connected to the roboRIO? 2nd port on the radio, or you have a switch in place?

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2024-03-12T01:54:28.404Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":160,"readers_count":159,"score":42.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":458277,"topic_slug":"photonvision-losing-connection-orange-pi","display_username":"fovea1959","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15648,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Herder of 3620 Programmers / LRI / CSA"},"post_url":"/t/photonvision-losing-connection-orange-pi/458277/11","custom_user_title":"Herder of 3620 Programmers / LRI / CSA","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3331148,"name":"Cole Wilson","username":"colew","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/f19dbf/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-12T15:37:12.523Z","cooked":"

We currently have tried both a switch and the 2nd radio port (same issue with both), but plan on using the switch. I’m not sure about the heartbeat incrementing, but I can check tomorrow.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2024-03-12T15:41:34.098Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":152,"readers_count":151,"score":35.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":458277,"topic_slug":"photonvision-losing-connection-orange-pi","display_username":"Cole Wilson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":15648,"username":"fovea1959","name":"fovea1959","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fovea1959/{size}/5301_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62619,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/photonvision-losing-connection-orange-pi/458277/12","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3335063,"name":"Barkın Var","username":"barkinvar","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/barkinvar/{size}/171468_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-17T11:00:04.196Z","cooked":"

Did you find a solution to your problem?

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":21,"updated_at":"2024-03-17T11:00:04.196Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":134,"readers_count":133,"score":31.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":458277,"topic_slug":"photonvision-losing-connection-orange-pi","display_username":"Barkın Var","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":15648,"username":"fovea1959","name":"fovea1959","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fovea1959/{size}/5301_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50115,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"9483 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/photonvision-losing-connection-orange-pi/458277/13","custom_user_title":"9483 Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3335066,"name":"fovea1959","username":"fovea1959","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fovea1959/{size}/5301_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-17T11:24:43.721Z","cooked":"

We have not. We have decided that we can get by without seeing notes on the floor, so we will be using Limelight for the rest of the season, and work on the OrangePi this summer.

I took an Orange Pi home and got it to run PhotonVision for 16 hours straight without dropouts, so it can be reliable. I don’t know if the difference was which Pi I used, power supply, lack of vibration…

We haven’t either: we are probably just going to go with a LimeLight.

I noticed that in our Pi the camera was getting to the Driver mode once in a while, which made it not to do other pipelines.
We also had 2 cameras plugged in there originally - Driver, note seeking, and AprilTag one.
The Apriltag one was the one that gave us most issues, so eventually we unplugged it and went with the LimeLight for the Apriltags. Less precise but works without fail.

I have a suspicion that 3A generated by the battery we use is not sufficient for both note detection and Apriltag pipelines, though I did not do detailed testing.

“Driver mode” is a new known issue with 2024.2.10:

Cameras are in Driver Mode on boot on OrangePi 5. · Issue #1285 · PhotonVision/photonvision (github.com)

Ugh-oh… what do we do to fix this?

How about going back to .9 ??

We really rely on the camera now to do things.

Follow that Discord channel for more info: • Discord | #developer-chat | PhotonVision

I just wanted to add a quick update! It turns out that our connection problems appear to have been from under-powering the pi. We were supplying it with 3A which is much too low it turns out. We bought a new 5V5A voltage regulator and it appears be working fine! We still have a couple issues with under-voltage when we are running on an old battery and we brown out, although that is a different issue and manageable.
